org.ossnipes.snipes.spf
Class PluginType

java.lang.Object
  org.ossnipes.snipes.spf.PluginType
All Implemented Interfaces:
SnipesLogger
Direct Known Subclasses:
Plugin, SuperPlugin
public abstract class PluginType
extends java.lang.Object
implements SnipesLogger

Base class used to represent a Snipes plugin type (a base class used to define the rough outline of a plugin, and what rights it should have within the bot All plugin types should inherit from bot type. If you create a Snipes plugin, it shouldn't inherit from PluginType class, rather something such as Snipes Super Plugin (SuperPlugin,) or Snipes Plugin (Plugin.)

handleEvent

protected abstract PluginPassResponse handleEvent(SnipesEvent event,
                                                  SnipesEventParams params)
Called when a Snipes event (internal or external) that you have the rights to handle happens.

Parameters:
event - The event, from the SnipesEvent enum
params - The paramaters, works just like a ArrayList.
Returns:
If you are able to cancel events (determined by your plugin type's canCancelEvents() method,) you may return PLUGIN_CANCELEVENT, if not, you may only return PLUGIN_PASSEVENT or null (does the same)

quitServer

Quits from the IRC server. Providing we are actually connected to an IRC server, the onDisconnect() method will be called as soon as the IRC server disconnects us.

sendMessage

protected final void sendMessage(java.lang.String target,
                                 java.lang.String message)
Sends a message to a channel or a private message to a user. These messages are added to the outgoing message queue and sent at the earliest possible opportunity.

Some examples: - 

    // Send the message "Hello!" to the channel #cs.
    sendMessage("#cs", "Hello!");

    // Send a private message to Paul that says "Hi".
    sendMessage("Paul", "Hi");
You may optionally apply colours, boldness, underlining, etc to the message by using the Colors class.

Parameters:
target - The name of the channel or user nick to send to.
message - The message to send.
See Also:
Colors

sendAction

protected final void sendAction(java.lang.String target,
                                java.lang.String action)
Sends an action to the channel or to a user.

Parameters:
target - The name of the channel or user nick to send to.
action - The action to send.
See Also:
Colors

sendNotice

                                java.lang.String notice)
Sends a notice to the channel or to a user.

Parameters:
target - The name of the channel or user nick to send to.
notice - The notice to send.

sendCTCPCommand

protected final void sendCTCPCommand(java.lang.String target,
                                     java.lang.String command)
Sends a CTCP command to a channel or user. (Client to client protocol). Examples of such commands are "PING ", "FINGER", "VERSION", etc. For example, if you wish to request the version of a user called "Dave", then you would call sendCTCPCommand("Dave", "VERSION");. The type of response to such commands is largely dependant on the target client software.

Parameters:
target - The name of the channel or user to send the CTCP message to.
command - The CTCP command to send.

changeNick

protected final void changeNick(java.lang.String newNick)
Attempt to change the current nick (nickname) of the bot when it is connected to an IRC server. After confirmation of a successful nick change, the getNick method will return the new nick.

Parameters:
newNick - The new nick to use.

setMode

protected final void setMode(java.lang.String channel,
                             java.lang.String mode)
Set the mode of a channel. this method attempts to set the mode of a channel. this may require the this to have operator status on the channel. For example, if the bot has operator status, we can grant operator status to "Dave" on the #cs channel by calling setMode("#cs", "+o Dave"); An alternative way of doing this would be to use the op method.

Parameters:
channel - The channel on which to perform the mode change.
mode - The new mode to apply to the channel. This may include zero or more arguments if necessary.
See Also:
op

sendInvite

protected final void sendInvite(java.lang.String nick,
                                java.lang.String channel)
Sends an invitation to join a channel. Some channels can be marked as "invite-only", so it may be useful to allow a bot to invite people into it.

Parameters:
nick - The nick of the user to invite
channel - The channel you are inviting the user to join.

ban

protected final void ban(java.lang.String channel,
                         java.lang.String hostmask)
Bans a user from a channel. An example of a valid hostmask is "*!*compu@*.18hp.net". bot may be used in conjunction with the kick method to permanently remove a user from a channel. Successful use of bot method may require the bot to have operator status itself.

Parameters:
channel - The channel to ban the user from.
hostmask - A hostmask representing the user we're banning.

unBan

protected final void unBan(java.lang.String channel,
                           java.lang.String hostmask)
Unbans a user from a channel. An example of a valid hostmask is "*!*compu@*.18hp.net". Successful use of bot method may require the bot to have operator status itself.

Parameters:
channel - The channel to unban the user from.
hostmask - A hostmask representing the user we're unbanning.

Grants operator privilidges to a user on a channel. Successful use of bot method may require the bot to have operator status itself.

Parameters:
channel - The channel we're opping the user on.
nick - The nick of the user we are opping.

Parameters:
channel - The channel we're deopping the user on.
nick - The nick of the user we are deopping.

Parameters:
channel - The channel we're voicing the user on.

setTopic

protected final void setTopic(java.lang.String channel,
                              java.lang.String topic)
Set the topic for a channel. bot method attempts to set the topic of a channel. bot may require the bot to have operator status if the topic is protected.

Parameters:
channel - The channel on which to perform the mode change.
topic - The new topic for the channel.

kick

protected final void kick(java.lang.String channel,
                          java.lang.String nick)
Kicks a user from a channel. bot method attempts to kick a user from a channel and may require the bot to have operator status in the channel.

Parameters:
channel - The channel to kick the user from.
nick - The nick of the user to kick.

kick

protected final void kick(java.lang.String channel,
                          java.lang.String nick,
                          java.lang.String reason)
Kicks a user from a channel, giving a reason. bot method attempts to kick a user from a channel and may require the bot to have operator status in the channel.

Parameters:
channel - The channel to kick the user from.
nick - The nick of the user to kick.
reason - A description of the reason for kicking a user.

listChannels

protected final void listChannels()
Issues a request for a list of all channels on the IRC server. When the Pircbot receives information for each channel, it will call the onChannelInfo method, which you will need to override if you want it to do anything useful.

See Also:
onChannelInfo

listChannels

protected final void listChannels(java.lang.String parameters)
Issues a request for a list of all channels on the IRC server. When the Pircbot receives information for each channel, it will call the onChannelInfo method, which you will need to override if you want it to do anything useful.

Some IRC servers support certain parameters for LIST requests. One example is a parameter of ">10" to list only those channels that have more than 10 users in them. Whether these parameters are supported or not will depend on the IRC server software.

Parameters:
parameters - The parameters to supply when requesting the list.
See Also:
onChannelInfo

dccSendFile

protected final DccFileTransfer dccSendFile(java.io.File file,
                                            java.lang.String nick,
                                            int timeout)
Sends a file to another user. Resuming is supported. The other user must be able to connect directly to your this to be able to receive the file.

You may throttle the speed of this file transfer by calling the setPacketDelay method on the DccFileTransfer that is returned.

this method may not be overridden.

Parameters:
file - The file to send.
nick - The user to whom the file is to be sent.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the recipient to acccept the file (we recommend about 120000).
Returns:
The DccFileTransfer that can be used to monitor bot transfer. Null if the Snipes instance cannot be found.
See Also:
DccFileTransfer

dccSendChatRequest

protected final DccChat dccSendChatRequest(java.lang.String nick,
                                           int timeout)
Attempts to establish a DCC CHAT session with a client. bot method issues the connection request to the client and then waits for the client to respond. If the connection is successfully made, then a DccChat object is returned by bot method. If the connection is not made within the time limit specified by the timeout value, then null is returned.

It is strongly recommended that you call bot method within a new Thread, as it may take a long time to return.

bot method may not be overridden.

Parameters:
nick - The nick of the user we are trying to establish a chat with.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the recipient to accept the chat connection (we recommend about 120000).
Returns:
a DccChat object that can be used to send and recieve lines of text. Returns null if the connection could not be made.
See Also:
DccChat

ipToLong

protected long ipToLong(byte[] address)
A convenient method that accepts an IP address represented by a byte[] of size 4 and returns this as a long representation of the same IP address.

Parameters:
address - the byte[] of size 4 representing the IP address.
Returns:
a long representation of the IP address.

getNick

protected java.lang.String getNick()
Returns:
The current nick of the bot

                    java.lang.String reason)
             throws NoSnipesInstanceException
Exits Snipes, with the given reason and the given status

Throws:
NoSnipesInstanceException
